info.name: Emergency 108 - Complete Testing Suite
info.description: Complete API testing collection for Emergency 108 system with OTP authentication, emergency lifecycle, and driver operations. Port: 8081. Based on FINAL_COMPLETE_VERIFICATION.md

item.name: 1. Authentication

request.description: Send OTP to PUBLIC user. System auto-creates user if doesn't exist.

item.name: 1.2 PUBLIC User - Verify OTP & Get Token

request.description: Verify OTP and receive 100-year JWT token. PUBLIC users don't need verification.
Send OTP to VERIFIED driver (phone: 9876500001)

item.name: 1.4 DRIVER User - Verify OTP & Get Token

request.description: Verify OTP for VERIFIED driver. This driver can accept emergencies immediately.
Send OTP to ADMIN user. Admin requires passkey in addition to OTP.

item.name: 1.6 ADMIN User - Verify OTP with Passkey

request.description: Verify OTP with 8-digit admin passkey (12345678). Admin authentication requires both OTP and passkey.
Test self-registration: User doesn't exist in DB, system auto-creates. No manual DB entry needed!
NEGATIVE TEST: Wrong admin passkey should fail with 401

item.description: All authentication tests for 3 user types: PUBLIC, DRIVER, ADMIN

item.name: 2. Emergency Lifecycle

request.description: Create emergency with 100-second confirmation deadline. Status: CREATED
Manual dispatch (early confirmation) - finds nearest VERIFIED+ONLINE driver with 60s timeout
Driver views their currently assigned emergency with timeout countdown
VERIFIED driver accepts emergency. Status: DISPATCHED ‚Üí IN_PROGRESS. Driver session: ONLINE ‚Üí ON_TRIP
Driver marks arrived at patient location. Status: IN_PROGRESS ‚Üí AT_PATIENT

item.name: 2.6 Driver - Mark Patient Picked Up (Hospital Assignment)

request.description: üè• HOSPITAL ROUTING: Auto-assigns nearest hospital using Haversine formula. Returns hospital details for UI integration.
üè• HOSPITAL ROUTING: Validates driver is within 100m of assigned hospital. Uses exact hospital coordinates from previous step.
‚ùå NEGATIVE TEST: Try to complete ~12km from hospital - should return 403 with distance error

item.description: Complete emergency lifecycle from creation to completion

item.name: 3. Cancellation Tests

request.description: Create emergency for early cancellation test (within 100s, no penalty)
Cancel emergency within 100s before dispatch - NO PENALTY, suspect_count NOT incremented
Create emergency for late cancellation test (after driver assigned)
Dispatch emergency to driver before testing late cancellation

item.name: 3.5 Driver Accepts for Late Cancel Test

request.description: Driver accepts before user cancels (testing late cancellation scenario)
Cancel after driver assigned - SUSPECT MARKING, suspect_count incremented, driver released

item.description: Test early cancellation (no penalty) and late cancellation (suspect marking)

request.description: Create emergency for driver rejection test
Driver rejects emergency - auto-redispatch to next nearest available driver

item.name: 5. Authorization Tests

request.description: NEGATIVE TEST: PUBLIC user cannot access driver endpoints - should return 403 Forbidden
Get token for PENDING driver (not verified yet)
PENDING driver can login but cannot accept emergencies
NEGATIVE TEST: PENDING driver cannot accept emergencies - only VERIFIED drivers can

item.description: Authorization checks: role-based access control, verification status checks

request.description: Check application health status
User confirms emergency is for SELF. Should trigger immediate mock notification.
User confirms emergency is for OTHER (Bystander). notifications skipped.
Update AI findings. This should be visible to the driver.
Send OTP to Notification User (Public)
Verify OTP for Notification User
Create emergency for SELF to trigger Helping Hand
Dispatch emergency to make it active and eligible for Helping Hand
